summary: J. Barry Harrelson was a CIA official involved in the review and release of JFK assassination records to the Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB). He served as a key point of contact between the CIA and the ARRB, addressing issues related to document declassification, protection of sensitive information (such as human sources, covert operations, and cryptonyms), and negotiating the release of records while balancing transparency with national security concerns. Harrelson's responsibilities included summarizing ARRB meetings, responding to ARRB requests for information, proposing solutions to protect sensitive information, and coordinating with other CIA officials on JFK-related matters. He was involved in discussions regarding the release of alias documentation, accommodation addresses, CIA station locations, and information related to specific individuals and operations connected to the JFK assassination.
significance: J. Barry Harrelson's significance lies in his role as a key CIA liaison to the ARRB during the declassification of JFK assassination records. He was instrumental in negotiating the release of documents while advocating for the protection of sensitive intelligence information, making him a central figure in the complex process of balancing transparency and national security within the context of the JFK assassination records review.
